summary: This bill, the Rotorcraft Operations Transparency and Oversight Reform Act (ROTOR Act), focuses on improving aviation safety through various measures. It mandates ADS-B In equipment on new and existing aircraft, revises ADS-B Out exceptions, and requires regular reporting on ADS-B usage. The bill also calls for a study on establishing a dynamic restricted area near DCA (Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport), an audit of the Army’s rotorcraft operations, and a review of helicopter routes. Finally, it repeals a provision regarding ADS-B equipment for Department of Defense aircraft.
